Class order

java.lang.Object
order
public class order
extends java.lang.Object
A helper class to store all information about an order

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    order()
    The default constructor for the order object that acts as a placeholder in the GUI before the order has been modified
    order​(int entreeId)
    An order object is created using the database-assigned integer for the entree of the order

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addDressing​(int d)
    Adds a dressing to the order object's entree object
    void addDrink​(int flavorId)
    Sets the drink flavor for the order object's drink object
    void addStarter​(int starterId)
    Adds the starter to the order according to the given starterID Adjusts the price of the order according to the starter
    void addTopping​(int t)
    Adds a topping to the order object's entree object
    int getNumToppings()
    Returns the number of toppings for the entree referenced by the order object
    double getTotal()
    Returns the total price for the order
    void removeDrink()
    Removes a drink added by the GUI to the order
    void removeStarter()
    A function that removes starter from total when server unselects it from GUI
    java.lang.String sqlQuery​(int employeeID)
    Creates and returns a string that contains a SQL update query to add the order to the database
    java.lang.String toString()
    toString() implementation for the order

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • order

      public order()
      The default constructor for the order object that acts as a placeholder in the GUI before the order has been modified

    • order

      public order​(int entreeId)
      An order object is created using the database-assigned integer for the entree of the order
      Parameters:
      entreeId - the database-assigned integer for the respective entree of the order

  • Method Details

    • getNumToppings

      public int getNumToppings()
      Returns the number of toppings for the entree referenced by the order object
      Returns:
      the number of toppings selected for the entree

    • addTopping

      public void addTopping​(int t)
      Adds a topping to the order object's entree object
      Parameters:
      t - the database-assigned integer for the topping

    • addDressing

      public void addDressing​(int d)
      Adds a dressing to the order object's entree object
      Parameters:
      d - the database-assigned integer for the dressing

    • addDrink

      public void addDrink​(int flavorId)
      Sets the drink flavor for the order object's drink object
      Parameters:
      flavorId - the database-assigned integer for the flavorId

    • removeDrink

      public void removeDrink()
      Removes a drink added by the GUI to the order

    • addStarter

      public void addStarter​(int starterId)
      Adds the starter to the order according to the given starterID Adjusts the price of the order according to the starter
      Parameters:
      starterId - ID of the starter to be added according to the database

    • removeStarter

      public void removeStarter()
      A function that removes starter from total when server unselects it from GUI

    • getTotal

      public double getTotal()
      Returns the total price for the order
      Returns:
      the price of the order

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      toString() implementation for the order
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      the String version of the order object

    • sqlQuery

      public java.lang.String sqlQuery​(int employeeID)
      Creates and returns a string that contains a SQL update query to add the order to the database
      Parameters:
      employeeID - the employee's associated ID on the database
      Returns:
      a query string that is passed in to the database to populat "Order" table
